page.title: 11Industrial Buildings
page.content: Industry in Farington revolves round a mixture of old and new buildings. Mill street linked the main Preston Leyland R to the mill and many of the workers lived in the street of terraced housing. The original mill was built in l830s is now nearly demolished and on the site are a number of small single storey industrial units. Most of these are supplying the adjacents larger industrial units. The modern 1970s build of British Leyland offices stands trast to the rather dirtied units of the rubber and paint works. During recent years British Leyland have virtually redeveloped their buildings, extending some and demolishing others. A fine example of a odern factory is the Spurrier works just by the Farington By Pass and adjacent to rail links.
